message.content:
cs.NI, cs.MM, cs.DC, cs.SY, cs.IT 

Reasoning: 
- cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) is the most likely category as the paper deals with device-to-device link scheduling and streaming, which are networking-related topics. 
- cs.MM (Multimedia) is also a likely category as the paper focuses on video quality adaptation in streaming. 
- cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) is another possible category as the paper proposes both centralized and distributed algorithms for device-to-device video scheduling and streaming. 
- cs.SY (Systems and Control) is a less likely category, but still possible as the paper deals with optimizing the performance of a system (device-to-device video delivery). 
- cs.IT (Information Theory) is also a less likely category, but still possible as the paper may involve some information theoretic concepts in the design of the proposed algorithms.
